content.description:
Start with your hands on the face, feet under the rock and climb through the roof start. Balancey moves as you move up the face.

 There are some other fun easy problems around here, like a nice finger crack, but a lot of questionable rock too.
content.protection: Pads to cover some rocks and a spotter to keep you from rolling.
content.location: The spine of rocks south of Manns Run up in the trees. Easily accessed from Chestnut Grove.

content.description: Climb face on crimps to top
content.location: This climb is about 60' directly above Easter Beagle on a natural outcropping.This the bolted route right of Pig Pen

content.description: Climb the slab on the left side of the face, ending at either the anchor to the right or continue left on very sparse bolts to a large tree.
content.protection: 3 bolts to Security Blanket anchor or 9 bolts up to a giant tree.
content.location: Left side of northwest facing slab just south of Good Grief.

content.description: Climb face right of Good Grief

Climb steep slab on the right side. To be fair gaining the first bolt try not to use the grassy cracks to the far right. After clipping said bolt stay on or slightly left of the remaining bolts to the anchor.
content.location: Right side of the slab on the lower part of the dirt cone.

content.description: Climb large crack to a steeper section and to top.
content.protection: Gear to 4"Share bolt anchor with What's up Chuck?
content.location: This climb is about 60' directly above Easter Beagle on a natural outcropping.To get there climb Trail thru the woods to its finish at a large tree.From the tree scramble up and right to the outcrop of rock

climbs.name: The joy is in the playing

content.description: Climb steep face to the top of the cliff
content.location: This climb is about 60' directly above Security Blanket on a natural outcropping.Just right of What's up Chuck?

content.description: Start in front of Pole just right of exceedingly rotten rock. Make tricky move off the ground and clip the first bolt. Gain the very narrow slabby ledge. Following the slab ignoring Â the wall on the left (questionable holds) and the cable. Move right on thin feet clip and then up passing more bolts. Gain a short fist crack and last bolt. Move up and left to anchor on thin feet.
Climb discontinuous crack on the right of slab. Move left at the top to a pine tree anchor
You can TR this from the anchor on top of the cliff.Climb the steep south face of this natural outcropping
content.location: Just right and around the corner of Joy is in the playing

content.description: Start behind a jumble of rocks. First bolt often wet.

This section is very new and not up to date and some climbs are not completely finished. This is a WIP but soon they will all be properly equipped - bear with me .

 A number of routes scattered about the hillside. Some start right off the trail, others some not so much.
